lead_paragraph: Bode Miller clinched his third super-combined World Cup title with a victory Sunday after Jean-Baptiste Grange failed to finish the second leg in Val d’Isère, France. Grange’s misstep gave Miller the win in the discipline standings before Miller finished first with a combined time of 2 minutes 18.45 seconds. Miller won his fifth World Cup event of the season and increased his lead in the overall World Cup standings.
